ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The doctor talked to my child about what he/she can do to become healthier
The doctor seemed to think it was important for my child to understand the visit
The doctor encouraged my child to talk
The doctor listened closely to my child talk
The doctor knows how to talk to children
The doctor used words too difficult for my child to understand
The doctor really understood how my child feels
The doctor explained things very well to my child
The doctor excluded my child from most of the discussion
My child could not understand most of what the doctor said
The doctor listened carefully to what I said
The doctor did not really give me a chance to say what was on my mind
I really felt understood by my child's doctor
The doctor failed to understand my main reason for coming
The doctor gave me a poor explanation of my child's illness
The doctor seemed to have other things on his/her mind
It may be too difficult for us to do exactly what the doctor told us to do
I intend to follow the doctor's instructions
I expect that it will be easy for me to follow the doctor's advice
It will be too much trouble to follow the doctor's advice
The doctor seemed to think about my child's problem carefully
After talking with the doctor, I feel I am handling my child's illness well
The doctor seemed to care about my child's feelings
The doctor made me feel I've done a good job of caring for my child
After talking with the doctor, I feel better about my child's illness
The doctor seemed to know just what to do for my child's problem
Respondent
Notes: 1 = Parent; 2 = Teacher; 3=Self; 4= Other; 5= Significant other; 6 = Parent 1; 7 = Parent 2; 999 = Not available
